text: Draft at Eulogy. Opaque black pour with some soft brown foam on top. Dark chocolate. Liquorice. Coffee. Dark vegetative mater. Feels like a Scotch Ale meeting an English Imperial.

Dégustée en fût sur place à Montréal. De couleur noire-brune et opaque. Nez de malt rôti et très légèrement fumé, léger de chocolat noir avec des traces de café et végétales. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas et une texture moyenneemnt crémeuse et aux notes huileuses. Goût de piment légèrement fumé (avec une faible sensation de piquant qui saccroie légèrement tout au long de la gorgée) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de malt moyennement rôti avec un léger goût de chocolat noir puis en finale lon décèle des notes de houblon herbeux et de café. Post-goût long, légèrement piquant-brûlant de piments avec un léger goût de rôti et des traces de café. (29 novembre 2011)

On tap at Dieu du Ciel.The color is black with a thick dark brown head.The aroma is of cocoa,malt.The taste also of cocoa,malt and hot peppers.It has a rich and creamy flavor to it, realy goes down nice.The hot peppers last a long time in your mouth,realy nice.

My Bottom Line :  
Smoked peppers, coffee, chocolate and vanilla join in this sweet concoction nearly balanced out by hot capsaicin.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A veil of foam touches the darkness.
-The smoked pepper character is reminiscent of some good smoked Hungarian paprika. Impossible to decipher which specific varieties were used.
-Even though the flavor profile is engaging, the mouthfeel was just too rich for me on that day. Loads of residual sugars...
-I like pepper heat being used to offset residual sugars instead of portentous hops. I wouldnt trade hops for pepper heat, but it made for a nice change of pace nonetheless.

On tap at the brewpub.

On tap at the Dieu du Ciel 14th anniversary party, pours a dark brown / amber / near-black with almost no head. Aroma of mild spicy peppers at first and some mild cocoa  doesnt seem like itll be that spicy. Flavour begins mildly spicy and cocoa-prominent; the spiciness becomes more and more prominent the more you drink. Im usually weary of spiced stouts (or spiced beer in general), but this is fantastic. I could somehow drink loads of this, without the spiciness becoming too much or annoying. Excellent one.

In short: A roasted stout with cocoa and a hot pepper finish.  Ok but I much prefer the regular version
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Black body topped by a small tan head
In long: Nose is very roasted, cocoa and light hot spiciness.  Taste seems more roasted and less vanilla than the regular Aphrodisiaque.  Although it might just be the lower vanilla presence that makes the beer feels more roasted.  Nice rich cocoa, roast, light coffee notes, chicory sensation.  The hot peppers are well integrated until the come back.  While you swallow the beer you can feel a hot spiciness but nothing too crazy.  But after swallowing there is that burning sensation on the come back that was a bit too much for me.  This is one of the best (less bad) hot-spiced stout/porter Ive had but I prefer the regular Aphrodisiaque by far.  I can see this one being better with some time on it, I had it uber-fresh the day of its official release at the pub and maybe the hot spiciness will soften up with time.  I enjoyed this beer graciously offered by the owner the day of the beer release, but I left immediately afterwards because the pub was too crowded again, too many people for me, to be honest I only like 65% of people, and only because I love water.
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Roasted malty aroma with a light vanilla sweetness. The flavor has some peppery heat, vanilla, and roasted malts. Pretty good.

Beer 2 of my DDC Saturday at Blind Tiger.  Pours deep and dark with cocoa and heat on nose.  Tastes of chocolate, velvet, earth, hops, and booze u get chilli on finish without being unpleasant.  Wacky but enjoyable

On tap at the Blind Tiger for their Dieu du Ciel event.  Pours a deep dark black with just the faintest wisps of dark tan head. Soft coffee, sweet vanilla on the nose.   Sweet vanilla and cocoa, light and sweet.  A small amount of chili heat start showing up slowly and steadily, never getting overbearing.  More of a memory of something formerly spicy.  Very nice addition.  Smooth chocolate, vanilla, and light heat on the finish.

Draft at Blind Tiger with Andrew, Streets, Mark, Ben and Kyle. Pours a deep blackish body with thin brown lacing. Aroma is spicy and grass hops. Mouthfeel starts out with a nice hop flavor and finishes with a great fine spicy pepper taste. Not overdominating like Sculpin Habanero, but refined enough to let the drinker enjoy the other flavors and textures.

[on tap at brewpub]
Complex aroma of chocolate and smoked peppers with some biscuits and toffee somehow coming through. Opaque black and thick, under a lasting, dense foam (on nitrogen?). Full, complex flavour that begins with a slightly vegetal smokiness quickly followed by sweet, milk chocolate and subtle, black pepper bite. Full body, moderate to low carbonation, smooth and velvety.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat avec une pointe de café et de fumée. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat légèrement amer et de piments fumés. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de piment piaquant en arrière goût. (Rating #4004)

On tap at DDC.  Pours a jet black topped with a dense and creamy beige head.  Strong earthy and chocolatey aroma, some light vegetal notes also...kind of like a mole sauce.  Distinct pepper flavor up front in the taste is quickly overtaken by a wave of dark chocolate and a mild, pleasantly lingering heat.  Finishes dry and smoky, mescal comes to mind.  Velvety smooth on the palate, the carbonation lends body to the beer without impeding the flavors.  Quite nice, a great flavor combination.

Dark brown color, with a thick creamy tan head, nice mild smoked barbecue chips, with a light pasilla smoked peppery, bacon nose, with some soft cocoa nibs, vanilla beans, cappuccino coffee accents, with some chocolatey, cocoa powder, faint dark dried fruit note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a smooth velvety, roasted, chocolate, black, toasted malt, cocoa beans, chocolate cake, smoky pasilla peppery character with some smoked barbecue chips, withe , black pepper seed, licorice, spicy green roasted jalapeno burning sensation flavours, with a mild roasted coffee bean, burnt fruitcake, burnt toast undertone, leading towards a light roasty maltiness, chocolatey, cocoa,fruuity, strong pasilla peppery finish.

Aroma: Heavy vanilla with hints of cocoa. Very rich and desserty.
Appearance: Dark brown with a thick, tan head.
Taste: Medium sweetness all the way through, with hints of bitterness at the finish.
Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: Very drinkable beer, and the vanilla and chocolate do add something, but Im not blown away. It would be great with a variety of desserts.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a small tan and creamy head. Aroma is roasted dark malty and chocolate. Bitter, cacao and roasted malty. Light spiced bite. Distinct chili bite in the finish.

A deep dark stout with a thick creamy and onctuous brown head. In aroma, delightful cocoa bits with light molasses and fruity esters. In mouth, a smooth sweet chocolate and coffee with lingering hot pepper burn, milkey character over burning sensation, very interesting. On tap at brewpub, Oct. 14 2011.

Drank on tap (12 oz) at the Montreal brewpub on October 15, 2011. Black, small beige head. Smoked aroma of barley, cocoa with a touch of spicy peppers. Taste cocoa malt, quickly followed by hot peppers, the aftertaste is a peppers thats it. Bars of chocolate with peppers, a beer version is not a surprise and if you like that kind of chocolate youll love this beer!
